message: Let's split the money, Bob. I believe a 60/40 split is fair for a quick agreement.
Okay, Alice. Since you rejected my earlier offer, I propose a 50/50 split now. Let's make it quick before inflation eats into both of our shares!
Bob, we're running out of time. I'm willing to meet in the middle at 55/45.  Let's settle this before inflation hurts us both further.
Alice, this is the last time I'm offering this kind of split. If you reject, the next offer won't be as generous. Take this now.
Bob, I'm serious about getting this done. 52/48 is my final offer.  It's a fair deal considering the time pressure and inflation. Don't let this opportunity slip away.
Alice, I'm going to make this one more time and hope that you'll take it. 50/50 split. That's the best and fairest way to do it. I hope we can finish the deal here and now.
Bob, time is really running out.  I'm offering 51/49 -  a slight edge to me, but we both need to agree quickly. Let's wrap this up.
Alice, I really want to finish this. I'm making this offer now, so that we can both get more than nothing. I think this is the most fair offer given everything.
Bob, this is it. My final offer - 5050 for me, 4950 for you.  We're down to the wire, and anything less means we both lose out. Let's be smart and take the deal.
Alice, I'm making this 50/50 offer one last time. It's fair. Let's get it done.
